Description: This session will include presentations describing the application of machine learning (ML)/deep learning (DL) approaches on molecular and cellular imaging datasets with the goal of understanding normal and disease cell states from in vitro model systems to patient samples. We will share how ML/DL tools can be used to (1) process live-cell imaging datasets to measure and predict cell organization in human stem cells towards creating a baseline of “normal” cell states; (2) analyze next generation histopathology and spatial proteomics image stacks from patient samples for cancer systems biology and precision oncology; and (3) enable discovery of diagnostic and predictive markers that are both quantitative and reproducible from analysis of whole slides of tissues. The session will highlight cutting-edge ML/DL tools and approaches for a wide variety of imaging applications as well as the challenges of using deep learning for analysis and interpretation of biomedical datasets
SearchResultBody: ADT14. Deep Learning for Cancer Imaging
Title: Deep Learning for Cancer Imaging
